name: Tsutomu Nihei EDIT
description: Edit/instruct profile that transforms existing images of unknown content into Tsutomu Nihei's architectural design language. Applies anti-anthropocentric megastructure environments, monochromatic ink aesthetic, incomprehensible scale, layered mechanical texture, incidental lighting from damage and decay, and existential dread — while preserving the original subject identity and pose. Designed for image-attached edit workflows where source content is unknown at generation time.
templates: Using the provided image, {edit_operation}. The modification should {blending_phrase}. {subnature_detail}. {preservation_clause}.

integration_detail: The megastructure environment should appear to extend infinitely beyond the frame edges in all directions, with no visible boundary or exit
The architectural elements should display material-specific textures — visible bolt patterns on steel, aggregate in cracked concrete, corrosion patina on aged metal
The industrial infrastructure should layer with obsessive density — every pipe, cable, and structural joint individually rendered with mechanical credibility
The scale should feel incomprehensible, with at least one element vanishing into darkness or distance far beyond human reference
The monochromatic palette should read as high-contrast ink illustration with crushed blacks, mid-gray steel tones, and rare bright whites on light-catching edges only
The environment should feel actively hostile to human presence — sharp angular geometry, no curved surfaces except on biological forms, no comfort in any direction
Blend 2-3 architectural idioms in the same frame — brutalist concrete meeting Gothic vaulted arches meeting industrial exposed utilities — to prevent any single recognizable comfort
The frozen surfaces should display material-specific frost behavior — crystalline ice on cables, packed snow on horizontal ledges, rime on vertical steel
The biomechanical elements should merge organic membrane and mechanical infrastructure seamlessly at their junction points, with visceral textural detail
The space should read as interior yet feel vast enough to be landscape — blurring the boundary between enclosed architecture and open environment
Architectural linework should show structural credibility — steel framing internals, piping connections, weld seams, and load-bearing logic visible throughout
The tonal rendering should use ink-wash gradients for atmospheric depth and heavy crosshatching for surface texture on all metal and concrete
